With the loan, he wants to buy more sugar, packaged milk, eggs, biscuits and mineral waters for sale in his restaurant. The profits from the business will be used for house renovations and to make some savings. 

He was happy with the previous loan, which he says helped in running the business, and he repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Dúo Manos Ayudadoras Group

texts.es:
DUO MANOS AYUDADORAS
La señora Maria Celestina de 47 años de edad, soltera,  desde hace 5 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en la calle principal de la colonia San Rafael de la zona 2 de Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de la señora María Celestina poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en:
TWO HELPING HANDS: Maria Celestina is 47 years old and single, and for five years now she has run a tortilla-making business located in in the main street of San Rafael Colony in Zone 2 of Chimaltenango. Through her hard work she managed to establish and improve her dwelling, and through her business, she has maintained and even gotten her family ahead.

Maria Celestina's dream is to be able to improve her and her family's quality of life through the microloans she requests through FAPE. With this loan, she wants to be able to buy corn so that she can continue to grow her tortilla-making business.

loans.use: buy corn to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab, a 50 year old man, lives in Batumi with his large family. He has a wife, two daughters, and one son. His wife and daughter work at a local department of culture in the Khelvachauri district. His son works as a security guard. 

Merab serves local people as a taxi driver. Because of high fuel prices, Merab decided to change the fuel system in his taxi. He applied for a loan through LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo. His request was approved through the Start Up program which is a joint initiative with Kiva that permits rural people to start or re-start businesses. 

Merab needs $600 to install gas equipment in his car. This will decrease expenses as gas is much cheaper than diesel. Merab is an experienced driver and hard-working person who awaits your support.

loans.use: To install gas equipment in his car

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette  lives in Buchanan and is 41 years old. She went to school through the ninth grade and is married with eight children between the ages of 3 and 24, of whom only six attend school and live at home. 

For five years she has been selling coal by the bag in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned selling from him. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal by the bag for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land, build a house, and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coal by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
Juan de 29 años de edad, estudio Bachillerato general, es casado; la esposa se dedica a los domésticos, tiene dos hijos.

Juan realiza viajes en un autobús, desde hace 4 años el oficio lo aprendió solo ya que vio la necesidad de poder hacer viajes en el autobús, también don Juan se dedica a la agricultura, el trabajo le queda a una distancia de 30 min en carro la ruta que él tiene es de llevar alumnos de la escuela de la comunidad al municipio, en este negocio solamente él se dedica;  el horario de trabajo es de las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

El préstamo que está solicitando a fundación Campo, es para comprar  llantas al autobús, ya que con la calle fea se le han terminado. El crédito mejorara el funcionamiento de su carro y podrá salir con más confianza a realizar su trabajo. 
Los sueños más grandes, son poder tener más buses en buen estado y más grande, para realizar su trabajo, poder salir a excursiones con las personas, hacerle viajes a lugares más largos, ya que con el que posee no puedo ir por el año del bus; pero con lo poco que le da de ganancias podrá ir ahorrando, para comprar uno en mejor estado y así poder tener más ingresos de alimentos en su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 29 years old and has a bachelor’s degree.  He is married and his wife is a housewife and they have two children.

Juan is a bus driver and learned this on his own four years ago when he noticed that there was a need for bus service.  Juan also farms in an area 30 minutes away by car.  He takes students to the local school on his bus route.  He is the only one who works in this business.  His work hours are from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm.

He is asking for this loan, through Fundación Campo, to buy tires for his bus since they have been used up because of the bad roads.  The loan will improve his car’s function and he will be able to go out to work with more confidence.

His greatest dreams are to be able to have more and bigger busses in good repair so he can do his work, be able to go out on trips with others, and make trips to places farther away since he can’t take long trips with his current bus because of its age.  But he will be able to save up little by little so he can buy one in better shape and be able to have more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy tires for his bus.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi was born in 1980. She is married and lives in Dair Alla, Jordan. Her husband is a driver. 

Hanadi has been selling clothes and accessories from her house for one year. She started her business selling a small amount of items. Now, she is seeking to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of clothes and accessories to raise her sales and to be a good financial support for her husband. 

Hanadi doesn't have enough money to increase her inventory, so she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and accessories for her business

loans.name: Bako Ibrahim

texts.en:
Bako is a 40-year-old mother of 6 children. She resides in Nimule Town, South Sudan, where she operates a grocery stall business in the open market. She heard about Finance South Sudan through friends. She has been in this business for about 12 years and has employed one staff person to help her run the business.

Bako is borrowing a loan worth 500 South Sudanese pounds to help her buy more stock like mangoes, oranges, bananas, onions, tomatoes and many other foodstuffs.

The loan will also help her feed her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries like mangos, tomatoes, onions and others

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Because Sameera is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Sameera was born in 1962. She is married and has 6 children. All of them are living in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour.

Sameera's husband is a retired man who distributes water with his water tanker, which is their only source of income. He is currently facing a problem with running his business because the tires of his water tanker need to be repaired but, as he is facing a financial crisis, he doesn't have enough money to buy new tires. For this reason, Sameera has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair the tires of his water tanker

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
From Batumi city, Davit is 24 years old and lives with his wife and mother, both of whom are currently unemployed. Davit's main economic activity is his newly-started café, where traditional Georgian meals and various beverages are sold. His enterprise is profitable, but it needs support for further development. 

Davit decided to expand his business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he didn't satisfy their requirements. He received the credit within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo called Start-up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With a loan of 1800 USD, Davit will purchase inventories such as a display refrigerator, chairs and dishes for expanding his activities. Summertime is the high season for the café business, and Davit believes that the business will be lucrative. His regular customers will be locals and passersby. 

Davit is grateful to all Kiva lenders for helping him expand his activity to make it more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his cafe

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a single mother of one child and her child doesn’t go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Prossy has a business, selling boiled eggs. She has applied for a loan of UGX 300,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy trays of eggs and charcoal. She sells in markets and also supplies to markets. She sells on a retail basis, seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  

Prossy aspires to expand her business to nearby markets and to start rearing eggs herself. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs and charcoal.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina 
Puntarenas


Lina tiene 52,  ha trabajado desde hace 15 años en el comercio y este es el noveno préstamo que adquiere en Fundación Mujer, ha demostrado ser una mujer emprendedora y con su actividad a apoyado el ingreso familiar y el estudio de sus hijos. Ha vendido electrodomésticos traídos de Golfito, ha hecho rifas, ha apoyado a su esposo en el negocio de soldadura y ahora, junto a su hija  comercializa mercadería importada y además viaja a Nicaragua mensualmente para comprar zapatos. Ha demostrado una excelente conducta de pago y su actividad es consolidada en la zona.
Inició con un préstamo de  50.000 colones otorgado por su esposo, en el 2003. Por medio de una charla de información se involucra con Fundación Mujer, apoyando el desarrollo de su actividad desde entonces. A la fecha se mantiene activa y requiere del capital ya que su producto ha tenido mucha aceptación y desea invertir para la temporada de verano en la zona costera donde vive.
 Obtiene una ganancia cercana al 100%, el producto que trae por medio de su hija (bolsos y accesorios) ha tenido una muy buena acogida y genera una gran ganancia, además  los zapatos traídos de Nicaragua son de gran aceptación.
La clienta tiene una amplia experiencia en el comercio, tiene  un producto consolidado en el mercado por lo que mantienen una  clientela estable. Genera ingresos para su hogar y ha realizado mejoras a su casa de habitación producto de su actividad. Ha demostrado una excelente conducta de pago, crecimiento en su microempresa y fidelidad a Fundación Mujer.
texts.en:
Lina is 52 years old.  She has worked in retail since she was 15 years old, and this is the ninth loan she has received from Fundación Mujer.  She has demonstrated that she is an enterprising woman, and has supported her family's finances and her children's education through her work.  She has sold household appliances brought in form Golfito, she has done raffles, she has helped her husband in his welding business, and now, with her daughter, she is selling imported merchandise as well as shoes that she brings from Nicaragua monthly.  

She has shown excellent payment behavior and her business is strong in the area.  She started with a loan of 50,000 colones that was given by her husband in 2003.  After an informational session, she became involved with Fundación Mujer, and they have supported the development of her business ever since.  To this date, she remains active and is in need of this loan because her products have been well-received and she wants to invest for the summer season in the coastal region where she lives.  

She makes a profit that is close to 100%, and the products that her daughter brings (bags and accessories) have been very well-received and generate great revenues.  Additionally, the shoes she brings from Nicaragua are also well-received.  Lina has a lot of experience in retail, and she has an established product in the marketplace that allows her to maintain a stable customer base.  She has demonstrated excellent payment behavior, growth in her business and loyalty to Fundación Mujer.

loans.use: purchase clothing, accessories and jewelry.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 57-year-old, married mother of three children. She is the sole breadwinner for her children, because her husband doesn't work. So she takes the full responsibility of taking good care of their children.

Jamila has fifteen years of experience in the baking domain, and in July 2012, she started her own business. Currently, she runs it from her house, to support her family in their living. She specializes in making the traditional Lebanese bread, in addition to the tasty special breakfast and every time Manakish (folded dough with several tasty toppings as the customers may choose, such as thyme, cheese, and many others).

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. She will use the capital to increase her business merchandise with special raw materials to increase her production, especially for the coming Christmas celebration needs. In addition, she will buy an updated dough mixer and a new Saj oven with the loan capital. These will enable her to develop her business and come up with an impressive income.

She hopes to expand and develop her business through moving to a bigger location, in the future.

loans.use: to increase her raw materials for baking, and to buy an updated dough mixer and a new Saj oven.

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.en:
Navbahor is an industrious woman. She is 24 years old. She is married and has two little children. Navbahor has had her business for more than five years. She grows potatoes and wheat. Navbahor’s husband is a kind man, and he helps her with managing the business. She is going to make the circumcision ceremony for her son from the profit that she made this year.

Navbahor needs to sow some crops soon, but she hasn't enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Comerciantes Group

texts.es:
DÚO MUJERES COMERCIANTES

Este grupo formado por doña  Yolanda, de 23 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijos aun no van a la escuela, y nos cuenta que está casada, y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida 3 veces por semana y refacciones todos los días de manera ambulante por Sacsuy, desde hace 4 años, con su trabajo ella apoya a su esposo con los gastos personales, ella solicita este crédito para comprar una estufa para venta de tortillitas, chicharron, dobladas, etc., también comprar algunas verduras y frutas para la elaboración de atoles ya que comprando por mayor ella le gana un poco más la meta de ella es poder ayudar a su esposo en la construcción de su casa.
texts.en: The Dúo Mujeres Comerciantes (Women Traders Duo) is a group that has been formed by Yolanda, who is 23 years old and has 2 children who don’t go to school yet. She says she is married and that she works 3 times a week in her small food stall, on top of daily selling light refreshments door to door in the town of Sacsuy. She has been engaged in this activity for 4 years, and thanks to her job she helps her husband paying for their personal needs. She is requesting a loan to buy a stove to prepare tortillas, pork scratchings and “dobladas” (a type of pupusas, eaten at Christmas in Guatemala), as well as to buy some fruits and vegetable to prepare corn flour drinks. She will buy at wholesale Price in order to pay a little less. Her goal is to succeed in helping her husband with the building of their house.

loans.use: To buy a stove to prepare tortillas, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es: José es originario de la Ciudad de Boaco, de 32 años de edad. Casado y padre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de CD musical. Inicio este negocio hace varios años; anteriormente le trabajaba a un señor vendiendo ropa nueva. Luego, con el pago semanal que recibía fue ahorrando poco a poco para comprar CD. Hoy en día tiene su propio negocio establecido y muy rentable. Su meta próxima es seguir comprando CD  de músicas para salir a venderlos. Solicita el crédito para comprar CD´s de todo tipo de música para la venta, con el fin de ofrecer una variedad de músicas a sus clientes. Estima que le crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mejores ganancias con las ventas de CD. Su plan futuro es crecer más en su negocio y productos.
texts.en: José is originally from Ciudad de Boaco. He is 32 years old, married, and the father of three children. He is in the business of selling music CDs. He started this business several years ago; before that, he worked for a man selling new clothing. He saved a little of his weekly paycheck at a time to buy CDs. Today he has his own established and very profitable business.His next goal is to keep buying music CDs for resale. He is requesting this loan to purchase CDs of every different kind of music, which he will then sell, so that he can offer a wide variety of music to his customers. He believes that the loan will be very helpful and will help him earn more income on his CD sales. His future plans are to expand his business and product line.

loans.use: buy all kinds of music CDs for resale

loans.name: Dúo El Manzanillo Group

texts.es: Dúo El Manzanillo, representado por doña Claudia de 32 años casada, y tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como albañil, doña Claudia se vio en la necesidad de emprender un negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que estaban pasando por momentos difíciles, ahora es buscada ya que desde hace 3 años, empezó vendiendo refacciones y ahora también vende almuerzos todos los días, y los fines de semana también vende seviches,en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboracion de almuerzoz.
texts.en: Partnership El Manzanilla: represented by Ms. Claudia, 32 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Three years ago Claudia found herself needing to start a business to help her husband with the household expenses, as they were experiencing some hard times.  She found what she needed and started to sell snacks, a business she has since expanded to selling lunch everyday. On weekends, she also sells ceviche. She is requesting this loan to buy food products which will help her make and sell her lunches.

loans.use: buy food supplies to make and sell lunches.

loans.name: Sarwat

texts.en:
Sarwat is the age of 36 and is living with her spouse and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a milkman by profession and he sells milk in the market. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he sells. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household's needs because there are too many competitors in the market and the customers as well. Due to quality and reasonable rates, most of the customers like to buy milk from him.

He wants to increase his stock and wants to buy milk in a large quantity, but he does not have enough to buy milk in a large quantity. Therefore, Sarwat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more milk to sell.

Sarwat is very happy after receiving this loan, and she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 49-year-old woman, living with her nine children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Zahida's family is very poor. She has been feeding her nine children. There are only some earning persons who are contributing to the household expenses. Zahida has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for one of her sons but mostly her savings is spent on her huge family. Now she wants to buy the rickshaw but she does not have enough money left. Zahida requested a loan so that she can buy the rickshaw with the contribution of her savings.  She hopes that her son will drive it with his full devotion and earn sufficient income.

Zahida is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Here is Esther from Liberia. She lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. She was unable to go to school. She is married to a teacher and has three children between the ages of 15 and 30, who all live at home. For the past 16 years she has been selling fufu (a starchy food made from cassava) and fish in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fufu and fish for her business. She enjoys the profit she makes from her business, and having her children in school makes her proud. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fufu and fish for her business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina es una joven de 24 años de edad en un estado civil de unión libre, madre de 4 hijos dedicada a la agricultura y a los quehaceres del hogar. A parte del trabajo de la agricultura ella tiene un pequeño negocio de pulperia con el cual ayuda a su compañero a cubrir algunos gastos en el hogar como el pago de luz y agua mientras el aporta con la alimentación. Fue gracias a su padre que ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra ya que en su familia la agricultura es una vocación familiar y única fuente de ingresos con los que han podido crecer y sobresalir en su negocio. Sus clientes son los diferentes intermediarios, vecinos, familiares y amigos de la zona así como también los diferentes beneficios en ocasiones.
Hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, limpieza y mano de obra ya que de esta forma ella podrá fortalecer y hacer que el grano de café se desarrolle sano y con un buen tamaño para su venta ya que la calidad de vida de su familia depende del ingreso de este rubro pues espera que el precio de compra del café pueda beneficiarle en grande para seguir invirtiendo en la ampliación de sus cultivos. 
Los planes para el futuro seguir ampliando sus cosechas de café mediante la compra de tierra y la siembra de nuevas plantillas de café como el caturra, el nance entre otros que son mejores pagados en el mercado.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a young woman, 24 years old, who lives in a common-law marriage and is the mother of four children. She is a farmer and a homemaker. Besides her farm work, she also has a small corner grocery store with which she is able to help her partner cover the household expenses. For example, she covers the costs of electricity and water, while he covers food expenses. She learned to work the land through her father, as her family has long been farmers. This was her only source of income as she grew and expanded her business. Her customers are various middlemen, neighbors, acquaintances, and friends from the area, as well as various other profit [sources] at times.

Today, she is requesting financing from the COMIXMUL cooperative, which she will invest in the purchase of farming supplies such as fertilizers, manure, cleaners and labor costs, since this is how she will strengthen and develop her coffee beans to make them healthy and the right size for sale. Her family's quality of life depends on the income from this, so she hopes that the purchase price of the coffee will enable her to continue investing in expanding her crops.

Her plans for the future include expanding her coffee planting through the purchase of land and the planting of new varieties of coffee such as caturra and others that are more highly compensated in the market.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, cleaners, and labor costs to help her grow coffee.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother). She has a business of selling used shoes and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She works three days at the market and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She aspires to import used shoes and become a wholesaler.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba es una campesina humilde y trabajadora, madre soltera de 5 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde pequeña aprendió todas las labores del campo y, hoy en día posee cultivos de plátano y yuca, cuyas cosechas vende a sus vecinos, familiares y los habitantes de la comunidad, generando los ingresos suficientes para el sustento familiar. 
Con el ánimo de mejorar las finanzas familiares, Rosalba desea comprar una motosierra con el ideal de poner a trabajar a uno de sus hijos como aserrador, pues el servicio es muy solicitado en la zona y casi no hay persona que realicen la labor, haciendo de esto una ventaja para generar mejores ingresos.
Rosalba manifiesta que su único propósito es mejorar las condiciones de vida para tener la oportunidad de disfrutar una vejez tranquila y sin preocupaciones monetarias, además pretende fortalecer sus negocios para dejar un buen legado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalba is from the country and is a hardworking single mother with five children whom she has gotten ahead with lots of effort and dedication.

She learned to work in the fields when she was very young and now has banana and yucca crops which she harvests and sells to neighbors, relatives, and the community residents.  This generates the income she needs to support her family.

With the desire to improve her financial situation, Rosalba wants to buy a chainsaw so she can put one of her sons to work as a lumberjack because this service is in demand in the area and there are not many people who do it, giving her an advantage in generating better income.

Rosalba says that her only purpose is to improve her quality of life so she can have the opportunity to enjoy her old age in a relaxed manner and without financial worries.  She also wants to strengthen her business to leave  good legacy to her children.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce as his source of income. He started this business to generate income and look after his family. He has a personal goal of building a permanent home.His main hardships are price fluctuations and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands. He has hopes of owning a big factory of produce. 

He intends to use the loan to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, es casada tiene seis hijos, vive en casa propia la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de urb. Señor de Lagunas de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel primaria. Su esposo es albañil trabaja en diferentes obras en la ciudad de El Alto.Maria vende en la feria de su zona sus productos para poder ayudar economicamente a su familia. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construccion (cemento, estuco,arena, fierros y otros).
El sueño de Maria es ofrecer comodidad a toda su familia ya que es numerosa y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has six children.  She lives in a home of her own, located in the urban zone, Señor de Lagunas, in El Alto.

She has an elementary school education.  Her husband works as a mason on different jobs in the city of El Alto.  Maria sells her products in the fairs in her zone, so that she can help her family financially.

She needs this loan to buy building materials (cement, stucco, sand, iron bars, and other things).

Maria’s dream is to offer comfort to her family, which is large, and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
Dara, 29, is single. He lives with his mother, brother, and sister in a village across from the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Dara buys and sells cotton and silk fabric. His mother is a weaver. 

Dara wants to renovate his house because it is small and old. Therefore, he is applying for this loan.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo) lives in a village about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two sons and three daughters.  Two are construction workers, two are garment workers and another one attends school. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Srey stays at home. The main source of income is from her children and her husband’s salary. A recipient of a previous Kiva loan, she is now requesting another loan of $1,500 to organize her house by laying brick and by plastering the walls in order to visually enhance it.

loans.use: To lay brick and plaster the wall of her house.

loans.name: San Pablo De Chauca Group

texts.es: El grupo “SAN PABLO DE CHAUCA” está conformado por socios emprendedores quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio y a la agricultura. Carmen tiene 60 es soltera con 02 hijos independientes. Hace 10 años implemento su bodega en el cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad  arroz azúcar aceite bebidas golosinas y a la se dedica al cultivo de palta chirimoya para luego expenderlos a sus clientes. En sus tiempos libres brinda servicios de mantenimiento en la municipalidad donde radica. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz azúcar bebidas y golosinas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Carmen es la cuarta del lado derecho viste chopa de color palo rosa.
texts.en: The “Saint Paul of Chauca Group” is composed of resourceful members who engage in different retail activities and in agriculture. Carmen is 60 years old, she is single and she has 2 economically independent children. For the past 10 years she has been running and expanding her general store where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, oil, drinks and sweets; she also engages in growing avocados and custard apples to then sell them to her customers. In her free time she offers maintenance services in the town where she lives. The loans she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, drinks and sweets. The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan. Carmen is the fourth form the right, and she wears a pink jacket.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Rosa Concepcion

texts.es: Rosa de 52 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos. Ella se gana la vida por medio de  la comercialización de velas aromáticas. Es una mujer admirable quien desde hace 6 años emprendió su negocio de velas y hasta la fecha es lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Desea incrementar las ventas ya que este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y desea cubrir una mayor demanda. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de materiales necesarios (parafina, moldes, aromas, accesorios, etc.) para la elaboración de velas y así poder satisfacer una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa is 52 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own home along with her two children. She earns her living by making and selling scented candles. She is an admirable woman who started this business six years ago, and to date, this is what has allowed her sustain her household. She wants to increase her sales since this is her primary source of income, and she wants to cover increasing demand. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of the materials she needs to make her candles, including paraffin, molds, fragrances, accessories and more. With the loan she will be able to meet greater demand and increase her income.

loans.use: buy paraffin, molds, fragrances and accessories for candle-making.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria de 57 años de edad habita en condiciones muy sencillas y humildes junto a su hijo quien es su fuente de inspiración para trabajar muy duro.  Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa la cual comercializa de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su comunidad. Ella desea invertir en su negocio ya que en esta temporada navideña las ventas tienden a incrementar y desea aprovechar la oportunidad para mejorar sus ingresos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa (blusas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, ropa interior, etc.). Confía que de esta forma logrará incrementar sus ventas y respectivamente sus ingresos.
texts.en: Gloria, 57, lives simply and humbly along with her son, who is her source of of inspiration to work hard. She makes a living buying and selling clothing, which she sells by traveling around the main areas of her community. She would like to invest in her business because her sales tend to increase  during the Christmas season. She wants to take advantage of the opportunity to improve her income. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying a variety of clothing such as blouses, skirts, dresses, pants, and undergarments. She believes that this will allow her to increase sales and, in turn, her income.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, pants, undergarments, and more.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier de 40 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 10 años de edad. Javier es muy emprendedor  y  trabaja duramente para casar a delante a su familia. Él se dedica  a la confección de ropa y a la venta de antojitos típicos (pasteles de carne, yuca frita, canoas, etc.), la venta la realiza de manera ambulante y es así como se gana la vida y mantiene a su familia. con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida desea invertir en su negocio especialmente en la venta de antojitos típicos ya que son muy demandados por sus clientes. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: verduras, plátanos, leche, azúcar, aceite, etc. Confía que de esta forma logrará incrementar sus ventas y así mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Javier, 40 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and 10-year-old daughter. Javier is very enterprising and he works hard to get his family ahead. His main work is making clothing and selling typical snacks (meat pies, fried yucca, stuffed zucchini, etc).  His food sales are mobile, and this is how he earns his living and supports his family. Wanting to improve his living conditions, he wishes to invest in his business, particularly in the sale of typical snacks, which are very greatly demanded by his customers. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of necessary ingredients such as vegetables, plantains, milk, sugar, oil, and more. He is confident that this way he can successfully expand his sales and his income enough to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: buy ingredients for his food cart.

loans.name: Dionicia Amanda

texts.es:
Zenobia nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos. 

Zenobia se siente alegre por el apoyo brindado y por el préstamo porque le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua dedicándose a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Zenobia was born and lives in the city of Pilco-Grande.  She is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has six children. 

Zenobia is happy about the support and for the loan because it helped her increase her working capital.  She continues to farm and raise small animals such as Guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and other things.  She needs this loan to buy small animals. (The Pilco-Grande community is located in the Huayllabamba district, within the Paucartambo province, and the Cusco department of Peru).

loans.use: to buy small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Dorymar

texts.es:
Dorymar tiene 35 años y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella se siente agradecida por el anterior crédito y le ayudo mucho con el capital del negocio de venta de cosméticos pero ahora también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.    
Dorymar está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dorymar is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. Dorymar is grateful for her previous loan, which greatly helped to provide business capital for selling cosmetics. She now also has a small grocery store. Therefore, she is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other products.

Dorymar is pleased with the loan that has been provided, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and other products.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia nació en la ciudad de Apurímac pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 64 años de edad, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente agradecida por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la venta de comida y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, verduras, carne y otras cosas más. 

Zenobia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Zenobia was born in the city of Apurímac but currently lives in the city of Cusco. She is 64 years old. She is grateful to the lenders for the loan and is thankful for the support given. She continues to sell food and in this instance is requesting the loan to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, meat, and others.

Zenobia is happy with loan given and promises to pay her installments within the established period.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, meat, and others

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
This is Angeline. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures. She would like to apply for another loan, of 20,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Angeline dreams that her business will continue and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 33 years old, a male. He is a guardian of  a child who is 15 years old, whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer.  He is a farmer. He has been in this business for ten years. It is located in Mbarakachembe. In his business. He earns a monthly income of KES 5,050. He is taking out his first loan, of KES 20,000, which he intends to use to buy farm inputs. Paul will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for the future of his business and family are to expand his business and educate his child.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his farm.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en: Jerome is single and aged 28 years. He sells juices of all kinds. He has spent two years in the business. He was very touched with the previous loan, which helped in re-establishing his business to a better position. With this new loan, he would like to buy more juices for resale. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more juices for sale.

loans.name: Drocelle

texts.en: Drocelle is 24 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to add new items, such as rice and salts, to sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family and medical insurance for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more rice and salts to sell.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 26 years old. She is married with one child. She sells juices and has been in the business for the past two years. For the previous loan, she made on-time repayments and still has a focus of having a better future. With this new loan, she wants to buy more juices for sale, because the demand is high nowadays. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more juices for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Buchanan. She is 49 years old, and did not attend school beyond the 8th grade. She is married and has six children between the ages of 16 and 31. Three of her children are in school and live at home. For 22 years she has been selling rice, manpo (seasoned oil), spices, salt, oil, etc. in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned it from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, manpo, spices, salt, oil, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, manpo (seasoned oil), spices, salt, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 30 years old. She is a mother of three. She sells shoes and has been in the business for the past seven years. With the loan, she wants to buy more used shoes for sale. She plans to use the profits for buying a plot of land for use in cultivation.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Rukhul

texts.en:
Rukhul is a 33-year-old, married woman, and the mother of two children. The financial condition of her family is not good, because there is only a single person who has to support the whole family, by driving a rickshaw. Her husband generates only a little income in this profession. He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Rukhul has applied for a loan, for her husband. He wants to fix his vehicle so that he could drive it smoothly. She is hoping that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Rukhul is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance needed by the auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 53-year old woman who lives with her three children at her husband’s home in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a small canteen in a school; he offers chips, spicy food items, stationery and other items to the students. He also wants to offer food items such as burgers and sandwiches, but she does not have enough to buy ingredients. Kalsoom applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is a field partner of Kiva, to buy spicy ingredients for making burgers and sandwiches. She belongs to a poor family; her husband has grown old; and he does not fully contribute to the household expenses. Kalsoom seems very happy; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her son's canteen.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en: Ahlam was born in 1977. She is married and lives with her husband who is a farmer in a sector of Jordan called Dairalla. Ahlam has been trying her best to support her husband financially with her project of running her mini-market. Her project started with selling a small amount of products at home and it was profitable to her. Then she opened her own independent mini-market. Now she seeks to supply her mini-market with a large quantity of food products to raise her profit and to run her mini-market successfully. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to supply her mini-market with food products.

loans.name: Mayanja

texts.en: Mayanja  is a single mother of three children and two of her children go to school.  She also takes care of an additional family member (niece). She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.   She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and on and off electricity.  She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of weaves, cream relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a  Kiva borrower.  She describes herself to be God fearing.  She operates a retail business where she sells cereals.  Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family's challenge to be poor source of lighting.  She will use the KES 13,900 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting their house.  This will benefit seven family members. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 34 year old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is running a stationery shop alongside repairing printers which has boosted his income. He is faced with a hardship of low capital; however, he has a vision of having a well established IT solution centre. 
Emmanuel is in need of a loan to buy spare parts to repair his photocopier.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his photocopier.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is a Kiva borrower. She has 1 child. She describes herself as God fearing and ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high costs. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big boutique. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes for her retail business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 27 year old man. He operates a retail business where he sells gas. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more gas cylinders. His business goal is to be the main supplier within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders for his gas sales business

loans.name: Rafael Santo

texts.es:
Rafael es un campesino trabajador y humilde, padre de un hijo de 10 años a quien ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. No se dedicó a las actividades agropecuarias que sus padres le inculcaron desde pequeño, sino que encontró en el área comercial su alternativa de vida, pues se dedica a la venta de cerveza, mecato, gaseosas y licor en un pequeño espacio que adecuó cerca a sus vivienda, aprovechando que el clima de la región beneficia este tipo de actividades, ya que diariamente enfrentan altas temperaturas.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio y de seguir trabajando en la consecución de sus sueños, solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (cervezas, gaseosas, mecato, entre otros), para satisfacer la demanda actual y los diversos gustos de sus clientes; lo que le permitirá mejorar las ventas y los ingresos.
Así Rafael pretende seguir trabajando arduamente para dar a su hijo el sustento y la educación de buena calidad, además quiere costearse los estudios de mecánica automotriz, pues siempre ha sido su sueño y quiere seguir luchando para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Rafael is from the country and he is a hardworking and humble father of a 10 year old boy whom he has gotten ahead with great effort.  He didn’t dedicate himself to the farming activities that his parents taught him, instead he found an alternative and sells beer, mecato, soft drinks, and liquor from a space he set up in his home.  He is taking advantage of the fact that the climate in his area is good for this type of business because of the high temperatures.

With a desire to strengthen his business and continue working on achieving his dreams, he is asking for a loan to buy inventory in quantity (beer, soft drinks, mecato, and other things) to satisfy his customer demand and the varying tastes of his customers.  This will generate more sales and income for him.

In this way Rafael will continue working arduously so that he can support his son and provide him with a quality education.  He also wants to study to become an automotive mechanic because that has always been one of his dreams and he wants to continue pursuing it.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Fatumah

texts.en:
Fatumah is 36 years old and a resident of Matugga, a suburb of Wakiso. She is divorced and has one child, aged 7 years.  

Fatumah deals in the sale of artificial hair. She started the business in 2008 with the aim of boosting her income sources, while looking after her daughter by paying tuition and providing all the other basic needs.

Fatumah wants a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to purchase more stock for her business, so as to meet the demands of her customers. However, she faces a challenge of inadequate capital, competition, and changes in demands. 

Her customers are the neighboring shops, hairdressers and people from various towns, and mostly ladies who have the salons.

Fatumah is such a hardworking lady and always aims at getting more money to expand her business, since she has enough capacity to work.

loans.use: to buy artificial hair to sell.

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben is a father of two children, 16 and 12, and he has been running his custom drapery services in his city of residence for the past ten years. He wants to buy fabric for the drapes with this loan; it will be his first loan.

“I love making draperies; I love the colors, the texture of the fabric and the finished product; and I learned the skills in Greece. I have a large clientele and luckily people like to decorate homes often in our city, and that includes changing drapes. I help clients to make curtains on a budget. Even under the communist era people in our city valued drapes,“ said Arben during the interview.

loans.use: to buy fabric for custom drapery services

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en:
Awatef is a 64-year-old single woman who has been working as a tailor for 44 years. Her experience and talent has resulted in a strong reputation.

Awatef shares a shop with her sister. She runs her tailoring and clothing business while her sister sells home products. Awatef can't afford to open a separate shop alone, and believes that their shared shop attracts customers to things they might need and might not have been aware of.

Today, Awatef is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her holiday merchandise, and purchase special fabrics to develop her tailoring business.

She hopes that one day she will be able to develop her business by opening a separate shop.

loans.use: To increase her holiday merchandise.

loans.name: Dúo Estrellas Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Dúo Estrellas Relumbrantes
La señorita Rosa Del Carmen se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 16 años tiene ubicado su negocio en su domicilio, ella tiene 26 años de edad  inicio con la ayuda de su mama, necesita el crédito para poder comprar maíz por cantidades grandes y así mismo tener su bodega, por lo que en esta temporada se eleva  el costo del maíz, y de esa forma  poder tener más ganancia en su negocio su deseo más grande es  comprar una estufa industrial para la elaboración de sus tortillas,esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Dúo Estrellas Relumbrantes [Pair of Shining Stars]

The young woman Rosa del Carmen makes a living selling tortillas, which she has been doing for the last 16 years. Her business is located in her home. She is 26 years old and started with the help of her mother. She needs the loan to be able to buy corn in large quantities as well as maintain her small grocery store, since this is the season when the cost of corn increases. This way she will be able to increase the income of her business. Her biggest dream is to purchase an industrial stove for the production of her tortillas. She is hoping that the Kiva lenders will be able to help with the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: to purchase corn for the production and sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Alexandra Elizabeth

texts.es: A sus 18 años de edad Alexandra demuestra ser una joven emprendedora y responsable. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa juvenil masculina y  a la venta de perfumería.  De esta forma se gana la vida honradamente y colabora con la economía del hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y hacer crecer su negocio ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para  invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería (camisas, pantalones, camisetas, perfumería, etc.). Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
At the age of 18, Alexandra has shown that she is an enterprising and responsible young woman. 
She sells young men's clothing and perfumes. Through these sales, she makes an honest living and helps to contribute financially around the house. With the goal of improving her income and growing her business, she has decided to ask for this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in buying a greater quantity and variety of merchandise (shirts, pants, t-shirts, perfume, etc.). 
She says she has the ability to make payments that the loan entails.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, t-shirts, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es: Ana de 23 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, su madre y su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Ana se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de forma ambulante desde hace 2 años. Trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y llevar el sustento diario. Desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa interior ya que en esta temporada navideña las ventas tienden a aumentar y desea aprovechar esta oportunidad. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de ropa interior y así incrementar las ventas y por consecuencia sus ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, 23 years old, lives in her own home with her partner, her mother, and her 3-year-old son. Ana's main work is the traveling sales of undergarments, a line of work she has been in two years. It is hard work to get her family ahead and meet their daily needs. She wishes to invest in her business by purchasing greater quantities of undergarments since sales tend to increase during the Christmas season and she'd like to take advantage of the opportunity. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing a variety of undergarments, thus increasing her sales and her income.

loans.use: purchase various undergarments for resale

loans.name: Mehrona

texts.ru: Мехрона красавица, умница и добрая девушка. Ей 21 года и живет вместе с мамой, братом и сестрой. Ее родные очень гордятся ею. Она окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Таджикский Государственный Национальный Университет. Ее мать вырастила их с трудом, так как у нее было маленький доход. Кроме Мехроны ее сестра и брат тоже учатся. Ее мать не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебу в университете. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mehrona is a beautiful, smart and good girl. She is 21 years old and lives together with her mother, brothers and sisters. Her family is very proud of her. She finished secondary school and started at the Tajik State National University. 

Mehrona's mother had a hard time raising them, as she had a small income. One of Mehrona's sister and one brother also studies. Her mother is not in a position to pay for her tuition at the university. She requests a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her education

loans.name: Juan Crisostomo

texts.es:
Juan nació en la ciudad de Chimur pero vive en la comunidad de Pilco – Grande, él tiene 58 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos.

Juan se siente alegre por el apoyo brindado y por el préstamo porque le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio,  él continua dedicándose a la agricultura y tiene varios terrenos de cultivos  donde siembra papa, maíz, lizas, manzanas y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y etc. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Juan was born in the city of Chimur but lives in Pilco-Grande.  He is 58 years old, is in a common law marriage and has seven children.

Juan is happy for the support and for the loan which helped him increase his working capital and he continues to farm.  He has several plots of farmland where he raises potatoes, corn, apples, and also raises small animals such as Guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, etc.  He needs this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  (The Pilco-Grande community is located in the Huayllabamba district, within the Paucartambo province, and the Cusco department of Peru).

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Vernilyn

texts.en:
Vernilyn is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has an eight-year-old son. Vernilyn owns and operates a small eatery in her house, where she sells home-cooked foods.

Vernilyn is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients, such as pork and chicken, a table, and chairs. With these purchases, she will be able to cook and sell more food. This will augment her income. Vernilyn hopes to make her business both successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, a table, and chairs

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. She has a business selling snack foods. She makes banana cue (deep-fried saba (banana) covered with caramelized brown sugar) and sells it to nearby schools. Aside from her food business, Leonora is also engaged in seaweed farming. These are the sources of her income. Leonora is asking for a loan to buy more bananas and additional seaweed seedlings. With this, she will be able to improve her business, thus, augmenting her income.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and additional seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Margot Elizabeth

texts.es:
Margot Elizabeth nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 32  años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en especial pollipapas y salchipapas de forma ambulatoria. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo pollo, arroz, papas, verduras, salchichas y salsas. 

Margot Elizabeth está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Margot Elizabeth was born in the city of Cusco, which is where she currently lives. She is 32 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has a son. She makes a living selling food, especially pollipapas [chicken dish with french fries] and salchipapas [hot dog dish with french fries] at a food stand. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase goods such as chicken, rice, potatoes, vegetables, sausages, and sauces.

Margot Elizabeth is happy with the loan given and promises to make her payments within the established period.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as chicken, rice, potatoes, vegetables, sausages, and sauces.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 49 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past 13 years. She wants a loan to buy more maize, cassava and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings and to pay school fees for her children. She is very excited with her previous loan which transformed her life; that's why she needs to buy more items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize, cassava and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is 36 years old and he is married. He has two children, four and two years old, whom he supports. He was introduced to VisionFund Kenya (formerly KADET) by a KADET officer.  He has a retail shop and has been in this business for seven years. In his business he earns a monthly income of 36,260 KES. He is taking his second loan of 80,000 KES which he intends to use to buy more clothes, shoes, and belts and to renovate his shop. Abdallah will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future, business and family are to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, and belts and to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is a mother of one child. She sells different items in her boutique and has been in the business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as sugar, lotions and soaps to sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, lotions and soaps to sale.

loans.name: Grivasio

texts.en:
Grivasio is a 26-year-old married man with four children, aged eight, seven, four years and five months. They live in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who mainly grows tea. With the proceeds he has been able to buy more land to farm and pay school fees for his children. 

Like all responsible fathers Grivasio desires to educate his children up to the university level. He is also involved in the transportation business in order to earn extra money. Unpredictable weather changes and inadequate capital affect his business growth while his desire is to educate his children to attain degrees. Grivasio intends to use the loan to plant more tea.

loans.use: to plant tea.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гульзат 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 дочек. У Гульзат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульзат занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульзат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 3 бычка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульзат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Gulzat is 33 years old, married and raising three daughters together with her husband. Gulzat has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Gulzat works with livestock breeding, after having started 10 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulzat's persistent work, her farm currently as three dairy cows, one horse and three bulls. The monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulzat turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase cows and increase the number of livestock. Gulzat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and plans to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Javier De La Cruz

texts.es: Don Javier es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de tres hijos ya independientes. Tiene 43 años de edad. Es de oficio barbero, se dedica al negocio de barbería. Negocio que inicio hace varios años, con su primer negocio de pulpería. Luego decide poner un negocio de barbería en su casa; con una máquina y una silla plástica inicia su barbería. Actualmente, cuenta con este negocio el cual le ha generado buenos ingresos. Su meta próxima es seguir trabajando con el crédito para seguir creciendo con su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: una máquina para rasurar, talcos, toallas, Gillette, entre otros, con el fin de brindar un buen servicio de barbería. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que incrementara la demanda de los clientes lo que le generara buenos ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en: Javier is a native of the town of Boaco, he is 43 years old, he is married and he has three children who are economically independent. He is a barber and he runs a barber shop, an activity he started many years ago, setting it in his first activity, a grocery store. He then decided to open a barber shop in his house, starting it with a razor and a plastic chair. He currently runs this activity that has provided him with a good income. His next goal is to keep on working with the loans in order to make his acuity grow. He is requesting a loan to buy a shaving razor, talc, towels, Gillette razors and other products, in order to provide a good barber service. He thinks the loan will be profitable, as it will increase his customers’ request, thus resulting in a good income. His plans for the future include improving the infrastructure of his house.

loans.use: To buy a shaving razor, talc, towels and Gillette razors.

loans.name: Luz Teresa

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer emprendedora que se caracteriza por su carisma y su espíritu de superación. Hace aproximadamente 10 años tuvo la idea de montar su propio negocio, un local de entretenimiento en el que alquila juegos de billar y además ofrece mecato, gaseosas, cervezas, licor, entre otros; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y trabajan de lunes a domingo de 3:00 a 10:00 pm; la idea surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos adicionales para tener la capacidad de solventar los gastos de su familia, conformada por su esposo  y sus 3 hijos.
Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de realizar mejoras locativas (pintar las paredes del local) y comprar surtido al por mayor (cervezas, gaseosas, mecato, confitería, entre otros), así dará una mejor imagen al establecimiento y podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos para satisfacer el gusto de sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de las ventas, especialmente en la temporada decembrina.
Luz desea seguir acreditando y fortaleciendo su negocio, para que tenga mayor perdurabilidad en el tiempo y le garantice una estabilidad económica para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is an enterprising woman who is known for her charisma and her attitude of self-improvement. Around 10 years ago, she had the idea to open her own business, which is an entertainment venue where she rents out pool tables and offers pastries, soft drinks, beer, liquor, and other products. Her husband helps her and they work Monday through Sunday from 3:00 to 10:00 p.m. The idea came from the need to earn additional income so she could pay for family expenses. Her family includes her husband and three children.

She is currently requesting a loan to make improvements to the venue by painting the walls, and to buy wholesale products such as beer, soft drinks, pastries, and sweets. This will give her business a better image and she will be able to offer a variety of products to satisfy her customers' preferences. This will result in increased sales, especially in December.

Luz wants to keep strengthening her business and using credit so the business will last a long time. She also wants to guarantee stable finances so she can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make improvements to her venue by painting the walls and to stock up on wholesale products such as beer, soft drinks, pastries, and sweets.

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en: Ameera was born in 1975. She is married and a mother of six. All of them are living at a sector in Jordan called Irbid. For four years Ameera has been helping her husband in renting out children's bikes while their parents are having coffee or tea in the park. Now she is seeking a loan to buy more kids' bikes and carts to expand their service and raise their profit.

loans.use: to buy more types of children's bikes and toys.

loans.name: Seham

texts.en: Seham is a married woman who was born in 1977. She is a mother of two. Her husband works in a governmental entity, which she considers a weak source of income to cover their children's needs. She decided to help her husband financially by selling children toys and European shoes since one year ago, and found it profitable. Now she wants winter shoes merchandise for her store as winter is coming in order to raise her profit and sales. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy winter shoes for her business

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршед родился 1992 году в одних их кишлаков города Исфары. С детства мечтал обрести большие поля для пассива, как его дедушка. Он каждый день после школы ходил к деду и до поздних вечеров лета помогал ему. Когда вырос,после окончании средней школы, поступил в аграрный университет.Женился и живет с родителями.Сейчас учится заочно, и параллельно занимается делом и мечтой своего детства. Осенью он собрал весь урожай и продал. На накопленные деньги он  арендовал новую землю и хочет закупить зерна и минеральные удобрения. Но сейчас ему не хватает денег. Вот и обратился в Арванд,за материальной помощью. 
  На  полученные деньги он  расширит свой бизнес, таким образом улучшив свою жизнь и семью. Он очень благодарен сотрудникам организации Арванд за материальную помощь.
texts.en:
Khurshed was born in 1992, in one of the settlements in the city of Isfara. Since childhood he dreamed of being responsible for large fields, like his grandfather. Every day, after school, he went to his grandfather and helped him until late in the summer evening. When he grew up, after finishing secondary school, he started at the agricultural university. He got married and lives with his parents. 

Currently, Khurshed studies by distance, and in parallel he works with his childhood activities and dream. In the autumn he gathered all his harvest and sold it. For the money earned, he rented new land and would like to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers. However, he does not currently have enough money. Therefore he turned to Arvand for material support. For the money he receives, he expands his business and this way improves life for himself and his family. He is very thankful to the employees of Arvand for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jigiya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JIGIYA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35ans, 5enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des -préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
Mme AWA (1ère à gauche sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt 3 colis  de condiments Elle vend quotidiennement à FAKOLA et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group JIGIYA are married women, who average 35 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families FAKOLA, a prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work at any moment. They are on their first loan with the institution. 

Ms. AWA (first at the left in the photo) intends to use her loan to purchase 3 packets of condiments. She makes her sales each day in FAKOLA and is much in demand, especially on market days. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Darwin  Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 23 años de edad es soltero vive con su mama en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia  Los Ríos. 

Es integrante de ventanilla Virgen De Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en La Parroquia Puerto Pechiche que pertenece al Cantón  Pueblo Viejo. 

Manuel se dedica a la venta de maíz, arroz y crianza de gallinas.Solicita para la compra de se semillas fertilizantes, abonos organicos e inorganicos.Las compras se realizan en el comercial Montenegro. 

Su sueño es mejorar el cultivo y aummentar el nivel economico.El desafío que enfrenta es cobatir las plagas y enfermedades como por ejeplo la langosta. En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia y compartir la coida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 23 years old, and he is single.  He lives with his mother in the canton of Ventanas, within the Los Ríos Province.  He is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe group, which is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche that belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. 
 
Manuel works selling corn and rice, and he raises chickens. He is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and organic fertilizer. He will make his purchases in Montenegro. 

His dream is to improve his crop and raise his income level; and the challenge he faces is to combat diseases and infestations, such as locusts.  

In his free time he likes to be with his family, and share meals together with them.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a  Kiva borrower. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 19 years. She describes herself as visionary and ambitious. She operates a tailoring business where she makes suits and dresses for sale. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are both new and old customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fabric, threads and other materials for making clothes. Her business goal is to open more branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a piece of land. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and other materials for making clothes

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. He also grows crops for sale. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a rural area which is productive and his primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy stock of feeds and farm inputs. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy animal feeds and farm inputs. His business goal is to be a big farmer within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will live well.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 44-year-old woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 12 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and groceries for sale. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a rural area which is productive and her primary customers are local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy farm inputs. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will live well. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elden Francisco

texts.es:
Elden Francisco tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a las labores agrícolas en su cosechadora, también brinda este servicio a los agricultores de la zona, Elden es emprendedor ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su equipo de trabajo y de esta manera seguir ofreciendo el servicio y generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elden Francisco is 30-years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district. It is a community characterized by green landscapes. The people there make their livings in agriculture, as shop keepers and raising livestock. The area is located two hours from Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.

Elden works in agriculture with his harvester. He also offers this service to the farmers in the area.
