loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 32 years old. He lives in the village of Lusahovit in the Tavush region. This young farmer lives with his parents. He is married and he has two children. From time to time, Artur goes to the Russian Federation to work. He is also engaged in farming and agriculture in his village with his mother and father. Artur loves farming and takes care of his farm cattle with pleasure. He has two cows, a bull, a piglet and twenty chickens. As the result of their hard work, this family manages to sell meat, dairy-products, eggs, a large variety of fruits and also emmer. Artur says that he loves his village and farming activities very much and he dreams of making it richer, wider and more profitable.

Artur asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several calves and also animal fodder for them.

loans.use: to buy several calves and also animal fodder for them.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a hard-working woman. She is married. Nargis has had her own business for 3 years, and it is her source of income. She sells sugar, rice, beans, eggs, soft drinks, etc. 

She has not had many customers recently and that’s why she decided to widen the assortment of her goods in the New Year season. She is asking for a loan of 1000 USD. With it she is going to buy dairy products, meats and cold cuts, as she wishes to satisfy the demand from her customers, and always keep her store well-stocked. 

Her goal is to always keep her business brisk, as it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy food items for the New Year season

loans.name: Aracely Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar 	vive la señora Aracely, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  7 años y un bebé  de seis meses  de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una gasolinera de la localidad.
Doña Aracely se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan algo. Trabaja los ratos que está desocupada,  ella  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 4  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su marido con los gastos del hogar.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio del banco, le gusta porque con un crédito empezó su negocio. Su sueño es algún día tener un local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This is a place known for its commerce, its traditional fiestas of San Pedro and San Pablo and its people’s happiness.

Sra. Aracely lives here. She is 33 years old, married and has two children, who are 7 years old and six months old. The older child is in school. Her husband works at a gas station in the area.

Doña Aracely sells all kinds of clothing and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories). She sells door to door and also in her home where her customers come when they need something. She works when she is not busy. She sells on credit and collects from her customers every fifteen days. She has had this business for more than four years, with which she helps her husband with household expenses.

She is going to use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, perfume, creams and cosmetics. She has been in the communal bank since its beginning. She enjoys it because she began her business with one of its loans. Her dream is to some day have a shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha was born in 1982. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Marka with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is a technician. Maha has been selling homemade perfumes at her house for 1 year. She started her business selling a small amount of perfumes. Now she is seeking to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of the needed materials for making different perfumes. Adding variety to her business will raise her sales so that she can be a good financial support for her husband. Because she doesn't have enough money to expand her business, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of the needed material for making different perfumes.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en: Yaser was born in 1975. He is married and a father of 3. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Yaser has been running his own gas cylinders store for 3 years. He started this business selling them at home and then he moved to an independent store. Yaser is planning to expand his business by expanding the amount of gas cylinders that he sells in order to raise his sales and income to cover his family's needs. Because unfortunately he doesn't have enough money to expand his business, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders for his business.

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en: Wedad is a married woman who was born in 1976. She is a mother of 8. Her husband works at a governmental entity. Wedad has been running her mini market for 7 years. She started this business selling a small quantity of food products and found it profitable. Then she decided to expand her business by opening her own independent mini market. Now she wants to increase the merchandise in her mini market with a larger quantity of food products to raise her sales and income in order to cover her children's needs. She doesn't have enough money to do so and so has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more goods and food products to sell.

loans.name: Luara

texts.en: Luara, a 60-year-old woman, lives in a village called Akhalsopeli, in Senaki district.  She lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law.  Luara's husband works as a cleaner and gets 260 GEL monthly.  The family also runs agricultural activities.  They have land where they grow different kinds of vegetables for family use.  Luara runs a poultry business; she has hens and sell eggs.  The family decided to expand their husbandry and has requested a loan for purchasing a cow.  The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses.  Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1000 GEL for purchasing a milk cow.  After the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products like cheese and yogurt for sale. They will also use the milk products for family consumption.  The new business initiative will give Luara a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Flavienne

texts.en:
Flavienne is 60 years old. She has one child aged 22, who is enrolled in school. 

Flavienne sells beers and has been running the business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Joab

texts.en:
Joab lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Joab is married and has eight children. His wife runs a small grain shop. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty-five years now and they are currently growing grains, butternut squash, watermelon and sunflowers in their farm. Joab is looking forward to beekeeping as it will help in the conservation of his small forest and also because he loves bees.

This is Joab’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because of the support it offers in beehive management and the provision of a market for his honey. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay for school fees for his children and to cater to their basic needs. Joab’s hope for the future is to get better in handling bees and to learn more about other bee products.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh was born in 1992. He is single and lives in a sector of Jordan called Salt with his 3 siblings and his parents. Saleh decided to help his family financially after the financial crisis they have been facing by running his cafe. He has been doing this for 1 year. He started his business selling hot and cold drinks. Then he started expanding his business until he opened a cafe. Now he wants to buy a refrigerator where he can keep cold drinks and a coffee maker to raise his productivity and profit to support his family. He doesn't have enough money to do this, so he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a coffee maker for his business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county.  Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake.  Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area.  Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes.  Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

John is married and has six children.  Both he and his wife have been farming for twenty years now.  They are currently growing watermelon, sunflowers and cassava. John is interested in beekeeping because compared to other farming activities, it does not require a lot of land, it takes less time to manage, and it generates more income.

This is John’s first loan with Honey Care.  He likes to work with Honey Care because it will help him gain more knowledge in beekeeping.  He intends to use the proceeds from beekeeping to pay for fees and provide for the basic needs of his family.  His hope for the future is to expand his honey project and become the biggest producer of honey in his village.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en: Sumaya is a married woman who was born in 1983.  She lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband and 7 sons and daughter.  Sumaya has been raising sheep and selling their products for one year.  She started her project selling a few sheep.  Now she seeks to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of sheep in order to raise their productivity, which will lead to raising their sales and income.  But she doesn't have enough money to do so.  For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of sheep for her business

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county.  Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world.  Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry.  A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe.  Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Consolata is married and has seven children.  Both she and her husband are farmers.  They have been farming for thirty years now and are currently growing amaranth, maize, sunflowers and beans on their land.  Her husband is very old and is currently not working.  Consolata is excited about beekeeping as it will be an opportunity for her to earn extra income and the honey she will get will be a good source of medicine for coughs and burns.

This is Consolata’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the money generated from beekeeping to pay for fees, provide for their basic needs and to support her farming activities.  Consolata’s hope for the future is to expand her honey project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten was born in 1976.  She is a single woman living in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat with her parents and 5 siblings.  She works as an accountant in a private company.  At the same time she runs her project of selling cosmetic products, accessories and perfumes, which she has held for 2 years in order to support her family financially because of the financial crisis she faced.  Now she wants to add new cosmetic products to her sales that might attract more customers and raise her sales.  But she doesn't have enough money to do so.  For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products for her business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a married woman who was born in 1971. She is a mother of five children. Her husband works in agriculture. All of the family are living in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. 

Fatima has been running her project of selling blankets for one year to support her husband in covering their childrens' needs. She is now seeking to add selling winter clothes to her business, to raise her sales as the winter is coming. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to re-sell in her business.
